Description_Long: from GMT website:

Title: Field Commander: Napoleon
Description_Short: Guide France to glory across 14 solo campaigns, from Italy to The 100 Days.
Description_Long: Welcome to Field Commander: Napoleon, the third in our series of Field Commander games. The goal in designing this game system was to make the careers of some of historyâ€™s great commanders accessible in an easy to learn, fast playing game format. We decided on solitaire, because it had the proper feel. Commanders have staff and advisors, but in the end, they alone make the hard decisions that affect lives, change the course of campaigns, and decide the fate of nations.

Title: The Bottle Imp
Description_Short: The bottle imp brings riches... if it can be given away before the round ends.
Description_Long: In this trick-taking game based on the short story by Robert Louis Stevenson of the same name, the goal is to gain the most points over a series of hands (usually the goal is set to 200 pts). Cards are numbered 1-37 and are found in three colors, red (comprising largely the highest numbers), blue (mostly in the middle) and yellow (mostly the lowest numbers) with colors being analogous to the suit in a standard deck. There is one neutral card, the 19, that sets the price of the bottle.

Title: Dungeon Degenerates: Hand of Doom
Description_Short: The dark & dirty co-op game of swords, sausages & sorcery.
Description_Long: Dungeon Degenerates: Hand of Doom takes place in the Dark Fantasy Realm of the decaying Eastern Provinces of the WÃ?rstreich. Players take escaped criminal adventurers on unsavory missions through four distinct regions, each with their own monsters & encounters. As the players explore the WÃ?rstreich, danger levels rise continuously across the map. Players must complete their mission before the Hand of Doom descends on the board, unleashing evil magic on the land.

Title: Top Ten
Description_Short: Top Ten is a party game with answers from the most logical to the most eccentric.
Description_Long: Your goal in Top Ten is to survive five rounds, so you and your fellow players need to figure out how to get things in order!

Title: Rise of Empires
Description_Short: Compete to develop your ever-changing empire from Ancient Age to Modern Age.
Description_Long: Rise of Empires is an empire-building game in which players develop their ever changing empire from Ancient Age to Modern Age. War, economics, science and diplomacy are to be taken into consideration to successfully win this epic game.

Title: Arctic Scavengers
Description_Short: Fight, gamble and bluff in this desperate struggle for diminishing resources.
Description_Long: In the year 2097, the entire Earth was enveloped in a cataclysmic shift in climate, plunging the globe into another ice age. Nearly 90% of the worldâ€™s population was eliminated, driving the survivors to band together into loose communities and tribes.

Title: Puzzle Strike: Third Edition
Description_Short: Build a bag of gems and actions to overwhelm your opponent with gem damage!
Description_Long: Puzzle Strike is a card game played with cardboard chips instead of cards that simulates a puzzle video game such as Puzzle Fighter or Tetris.

Title: The New Era
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Four factions have grown and their boundaries widened. The conflict is not to be averted. Blood will soon be shed. The Mutants Union is the power that made rocks roll and attack, and the other factions responded quickly. The New Era begins, the era of war...

Title: Renature
Description_Short: Compete for the best ground as you restore a polluted valley with plants and animals.
Description_Long: Renature is a majority game with dominoes for 2-4 players.

Title: Kingdomino Origins
Description_Short: Go back in time to the prehistoric era of Kingdomino!
Description_Long: Go back in time to the prehistoric era of Kingdomino!

Title: Marrakech
Description_Short: When Assam lands on your carpet, the player who moved him must pay you.
Description_Long: In Marrakech each player takes the role of a rug salesperson who tries to outwit the competition. Each player starts with 10 coins and an equal number of carpets.

Title: Power Struggle
Description_Short: Race up the corporate ladder by bribing, conniving and besting your archnemesis.
Description_Long: This description was originally based on a review from BoardgameNews.com.

Title: Himalaya
Description_Short: Plan caravan journeys to raise your tribes piety, power and wealth in the Himalayas.
Description_Long: As the Chief of a Himalayan high plateau tribe; Dolpo-pa, Bhotia, Sherpa, or Tamang, you lead your yaks caravan from one village to another through snowy crests and risky paths in order to collect the goods necessary to the development of your tribe.

Title: The Climbers
Description_Short: Use the blocks to build your way to the top!
Description_Long: They gazed at the large structure of colorful blocks neatly stacked before them. The goal was simple: climb to the highest level possible. Getting there was more challenging than originally thought. Only one climber will make it to the top. Will it be you?

Title: Curious Cargo
Description_Short: Build your facilities with interweaving networks of tiles to ship cargo.
Description_Long: I stumbled upon a midnight market. It wasnt selling flowers or farm goods. It was a more curious sort of cargo: energy capacitors, strange crystalline material, and something green and jiggly. Since then, Ive been dragged into it, deep into the thick of it.

Title: On the Underground
Description_Short: Build the most successful lines for the Tube and help the Passenger commute!
Description_Long: Aim of the game from the rulebook:

Description_Short: An 18xx game with variable interest loans, mergers & acquisitions, and short selling.
Description_Long: 1817 is a railroad operations and share trading board game in the 18xx series with a distinct financial flair. It is named after the year the New York Stock Exchange opened at 40 Wall Street in New York.

Title: Human Punishment: Social Deduction 2.0
Description_Short: Secret teams try to rule the world after a successful machine revolution.
Description_Long: Human Punishment is a combination of social deduction, social experiment, and party game for 4-16 players. Each player takes on the role of a human, a machine, or an outlaw in a distant future. Players must investigate others to figure out who is on their side, grab one of the four different weapons, and eliminate the enemies. Stay focused because hidden enemies may be on your team! Find your team, trust no one!

Title: Oregon
Description_Short: Build settlements on the frontier and score the best combos!
Description_Long: Taken from Boardgame News:

Title: Tempel des Schreckens
Description_Short: Defend the temples as Amazons or rob it as adventurers in this social deduction game.
Description_Long: Youve finally reached the Temple of Secrets with its immense treasure of gold â€” but what awaits you here? Fabulous wealth or total destruction? The proud and mysterious temple guards who are hiding amongst the adventurers are trying to lure them onto the wrong track in order to protect their gold. Skillfully and with a deceitful tongue, they try to convince you to open the grave chambers behind which lies a dangerous fire trap. Can you trust anyone in the group when you dont know whether theyre friend or foe?

Title: The Great Dalmuti
Description_Short: Get rid of your cards to rise through society from peon to Dalmuti.
Description_Long: A light card game where players gain status by going out first.

Title: Ys
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: In remote times, King Gradlon had the magnificent city of Ys erected for his daughter Dahut. Gargantuan sea-walls protected the city from the violent waves. Dahut decided to make Ys the most powerful place in Brittany; thus, she dispatched dragons to seize merchant ships loaded with jewels which sailed on the open seaâ€?

Title: Pendragon: The Fall of Roman Britain
Description_Short: Britons and Barbarians struggle for political and military control over Britannia.
Description_Long: From GMTs website:

Title: Drop It
Description_Short: Drop geometric shapes in your color to score the most physics-defying points.
Description_Long: Circles, triangles, squares and diamonds: Drop It is about letting go, with the pieces you drop landing somewhere in the vertical game board, ideally where theyll score the most points, but the tiles bounce around and dont always land where you expect them to!

Title: Beyond Balderdash
Description_Short: Divine the true story from your opponents bluffs and hope you can fool them too.
Description_Long: Beyond Balderdash is the expanded second edition of Balderdash. Balderdash is based on bluffing your opponents into guessing your false definitions to obscure words. Beyond Balderdash adds several new categories to the mix: Movies (make up a plot), Dates (say what happened on it), People (say what the person did), and Initials (make up what they stand for). The real answers are often even more outrageous than the bluffs, so the game offers plenty of laughs.

Title: PitchCar Mini
Description_Short: Classic finger flicking game goes to the next level on this fast surface and corners
Description_Long: A mini version of Pitchcar with smaller track pieces. Contains 6 straight and 10 curve track pieces that allow the construction of more than 10 different racing circuits. 8 wooden cars are included as well.

Title: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
Description_Short: Hand-pick and equip an elite team to complete modern-era covert missions.
Description_Long: Command the worlds best Special Forces operators and complete vital assault missions around the world!

Title: GKR: Heavy Hitters
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Welcome to the biggest sport of the future  GIANT KILLER ROBOTS : HEAVY HITTERS!

Title: Axis & Allies
Description_Short: Re-fight WWII on a global scale with plastic soldiers, tanks, planes, and ships!
Description_Long: Axis & Allies (2004) aka Axis & Allies Revised Edition is the first Avalon Hill version of the classic light weight war game Axis & Allies. The game simulates the entire scope of World War II.

Title: Otys
Description_Short: Send your divers to collect treasures in the depths of post-apocalyptic oceans.
Description_Long: Mid-22nd century, after 300 years of unconsciousness, the water rising engulfs the last emerged lands. Fighting for their lives, the survivorâ€™s settlements must remain above the sea level. You live in the Otys colony and you must retrieve the past civilizations debris in the depths to build the future of humanity.

Title: The Lord of the Ice Garden
Description_Short: Mould the world to match your own twisted vision while avoiding the meddlesome hero.
Description_Long: The world of Midgaard, created by author JarosÅ‚aw GrzÄ™dowicz in The Lord of the Ice Garden novel series, is inhabited by a race very similar to humans, filled with magic and for a reason stuck at the cultural and technological level of medieval Viking world. The arrival of scientists from Earth disturbs its fragile balance. The power gained by controlling magic changes the scientists  they become possessed by the lust for making this world better. They become gods, who are willing to sacrifice any life, except for their own, of course, to accomplish their  great, according to them  ideas.

Title: World in Flames
Description_Short: All of World War II at a global scale.
Description_Long: (from ADG website :)

Title: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
Description_Short: Choose your faction, pick your class and fight for Azeroth.
Description_Long: Take on the role of a chivalrous paladin or a wise shaman, a holy priest or a vile warlock, a mighty mage or a crafty rogue. Play as a savage orc, a mighty tauren, a tribal troll, or one of the Forsaken undead; become an ingenious gnome, a doughty dwarf, a mysterious Night Elf, or a noble human.

Title: Horrified: American Monsters
Description_Short: Monsters from American folklore terrorize the nation. Can your team stop them?
Description_Long: Horrified: American Monsters is a standalone game that features gameplay similar to 2019s Horrified, which challenges players to overcome the Universal Monsters from classic films.

Title: Successors (Third Edition)
Description_Short: Card-based scrap between Alexanders generals to succeed to his empire.
Description_Long: When Alexander the Great died in 323 BC, he left no clear heir to the immense empire he had conquered. It was not long after his death that the Macedonian generals began to war among themselves over who would be the regent or successor to Alexanders empire. By 305 BC they had given up on succession and began to carve out their own kingdoms. Successors III is a four-player game based on those wars.

Title: Miyabi
Description_Short: Compete for tiles to collect the most of each element in your garden & build high!
Description_Long: Elegant, graceful, and refined  thatâ€™s how you should design your Japanese garden! Careful planning and watchful eyes are needed as you tend your garden. Only by skillfully placing stones, bushes, trees, ponds and pagodas on multiple levels can a player become the best garden designer of the season. Think youâ€™ve got it figured out? Try one of the five included expansions!

Title: Stella: Dixit Universe
Description_Short: Players confront each other with word-images association and risk management choices
Description_Long: Starseekers! Explore the sky and bring some light back to your world.

Title: Timeline: Discoveries
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Timeline: Discoveries is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts an discovery on both sides, with the year in which that discovery occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

Title: Unlock!: Mythic Adventures
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Unlock! is a series of escape adventures for up to six players. With one hour on the clock, players work through a deck of sixty cards as a team, searching for clues, combining objects, and solving puzzles. The free Unlock! companion app runs the timer while also providing clues, offering hints, and confirming successes. Once the team has reached a solution and entered the correct code into the app, they will escape and win the game!

Title: The Ancient World
Description_Short: Thrive in a wonderful world. Claim banners to become the most influential city-state.
Description_Long: In an ancient world forgotten by time, enormous titans terrorize the land. Five tribes have been fleeing from the titans for centuries, but things are about to change. Growing city-states pledge to end the reign of terror, determined to take on the titans and make the world a safer place for all. Each city-state competes to attract the tribes, eager for the strength of the combined peoples, who are now leaving behind old traditions with the hope that the titans can be defeated once and for all.

Title: A Study in Emerald (Second Edition)
Description_Short: Victorian agents seek to protect- or overthrow the Great Old Ones among us.
Description_Long: It is 1882, and the Old Ones are already here.

Title: Artifacts, Inc.
Description_Short: Go on expeditions to find artifacts, then sell them to museums for fame and fortune.
Description_Long: New York, 1929: A frenzy of interest in antiquity is sweeping the nation! With museums hungry for mysterious and exotic artifacts â€” and you hungry for adventure â€” you start up your own archeology company. Untold wonders await within dangerous jungles, harsh deserts, and wind-swept mountains. Will you gain a reputation as the most intrepid and famous adventurer of all time?

Title: Skulls of Sedlec
Description_Short: Stack skulls in the Sedlec Ossuary to help the deceased finally rest peacefully.
Description_Long: Sedlec Ossuary, 16th Century AD.

Title: Campy Creatures
Description_Short: Deploy an army of classic monsters to outwit your rivals & capture the most mortals.
Description_Long: Players are mad scientists in need of precious mortals for future experiments. Rather than getting your hands dirty, your army of campy creatures awaits to do your bidding. Capture the most valuable mortals over the course of three nights to win. But be warned â€” the mortals wont go down without a fight.

Title: Pergamon
Description_Short: Archaeologists compete to exhibit the best collection in the museum.
Description_Long: Pergamon is a tactical collecting game with a theme based on excavating archaeological discoveries and managing their exhibition.

Title: The Ancient World (Second Edition)
Description_Short: Battle ancient Titans while growing, building, and rebuilding your civilization.
Description_Long: In an ancient world forgotten by time, enormous titans terrorize the land. Five tribes have been fleeing from the titans for centuries, but things are about to change. Growing city-states pledge to end the reign of terror, determined to take on the titans and make the world a safer place for all. Each city-state competes to attract the tribes, eager for the strength of the combined peoples, who are now leaving behind old traditions with the hope that the titans can be defeated once and for all.

Title: Legendary Encounters: A Firefly Deck Building Game
Description_Short: Assemble the galaxys most lovable rogues to steal goods and escape the inevitable!
Description_Long: In Legendary Encounters: Firefly, players take on the roles of characters from the series and work together to complete objectives for episodes from the Firefly TV show. Players each select an Avatar out of the Main Characters of the game. Each game will have 5 Main Characters and 4 Supporting Characters, so all 9 crew members will be part of each game. The 14-card stack for each Supporting Character is shuffled together to form the Crew Deck, which will be used to build up each players deck.

Title: Adventure Land
Description_Short: Collect swords, herbs, and companions to fight monsters.
Description_Long: In Adventure Land, King Agamis rules from his castle. Rich cities, vast forests and rugged mountain ranges dominate the country. The large river is known to be lined with gold and the forests filled with medicinal herbs, but dangers lurk beneath the fog! Only the bravest adventurers dare to face the challenges. When you move your adventurer tactically and bravely fight the fog creatures, youll win the favor of the king. Illustrated by Franz Vohwinkel and designed by acclaimed duo Wolfgang Kramer and Michael Kiesling who between them have won the highly coveted Spiel des Jahres award 5 times.

Title: City of Iron
Description_Short: Explore new lands and build cities to find and produce the most valuable goods.
Description_Long: In City of Iron, 2-4 players compete to build up a small nation in a world of machines, magic, and money. Become the leader of one of four rival nations: the industrious humans, the toad engineers, the scholarly Cresarians, or the clever hogmen. Produce goods like machine parts and bottled demons to gain wealth, or research steam-age technology and recruit mercenaries to control the continent. If you want to establish new cities, youâ€™ll build schooners or airships to reach faraway lands and flying islands. Your cities have limited capacity, so youâ€™ll have to decide what to keep and what to demolish when building advanced structures. The future of a nation is in your hands. Build unbreakable foundations for an empire or disappear into the dusty pages of history.

Title: SET
Description_Short: Race to find a set of three among the twelve cards.
Description_Long: In SET, each card contains 1-3 objects, with all of the objects on a card having the same color, shape and shading, e.g., two purple shaded ovals. Colors, shapes, and shadings come in three different types: green, purple and red; oval, diamond and squiggle; and solid, shaded and outlined.

Title: A House Divided: War Between the States 1861-65
Description_Short: North and South fight in several Civil War battles.
Description_Long: from Mayfair Games website:

Title: Times Up! EdiciÃ?n Amarilla
Description_Short: Describe Cleopatra in few seconds. Then try in one word, a gesture or a posture.
Description_Long: Times Up! EdiciÃ?n Amarilla (Yellow edition) is a new edition of popular Times Up! game

Title: 51st State
Description_Short: Various survivors build and conquer in Neuroshimas wasteland.
Description_Long: The world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States have collapsed. And now, thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control over the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new State: the 51st State.

Title: Gulo Gulo
Description_Short: Remove the right eggs carefully to move forward and rescue your baby.
Description_Long: Each player is a Gulo, or wolverine, trying to rescue a baby Gulo who got caught by the swamp vulture whose eggs it was trying to steal. Unfortunately for the baby Gulo, all the adult Gulos are distracted by all the delicious swamp vulture eggs, and it has to wait very, very patiently as the adults constantly trip the very, very sensitive egg alarm rigged by the vulture to scare off the pesky Gulos.

Title: Unlock!: Mystery Adventures  The House on the Hill
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: At the beginning of The House on the Hill, strange, paranormal activities have surrounded an abandoned house for the past three days. When an investigation uncovers that these occult occurrences center on an excerpt read from The Book of the Dead, you and your companions are tasked to enter the house, find the book, and stop the curseâ€?

Title: Paper Dungeons: A Dungeon Scrawler Game
Description_Short: Explore dungeons, fight villains and conquer the glory in a hack n slash adventure.
Description_Long: Prepare your adventurers for a challenging dungeon exploration in Paper Dungeons, a roll-and-write game that seeks to reproduce the feel of a dungeon-crawler.

Title: Samurai Spirit
Description_Short: Together the honourable Samurai stand, to protect the village from the bandit man!
Description_Long: You and your fellow samurai companions are the only standing obstacle between one frightened village and a full horde of blood-thirsty villains. The fight seems unfair as the seven of you might not seem to measure up to the dozens of enemies who want to slice you to pieces â€” but this comparison doesnt take into account your strong combat skills and an efficient team spirit that binds your samurai squad enough to face the threat. Above all else, when everything seems desperate and lost, your enemies will discover that inside each of you lies a true beast, a warrior spirit ready to unleash its full power!

Title: Bios: Megafauna (Second Edition)
Description_Short: Choose your species and adapt or go extinct!
Description_Long: Bios:Megafauna starts where the predecessor game Bios:Genesis left off, with the invasion of the land on the daybreak of the Phanerozoic eon. Starting as either a plant, mollusk, insect, or vertebral skeletal type, your flapping, paddling, and squawking carnivores and herbivores make a beachhead on one of the drifting continental plates in the Cambrian, Their struggle for terrestrial dominance may eventually include language-based consciousness. Although this achievement elevated a certain mammal species to notoriety, in your game things may occur differently.

Title: Overboss: A Boss Monster Adventure
Description_Short: Conquer the overworld and become the Overboss in this puzzly map-building game.
Description_Long: In Overboss, rival Boss Monsters emerge from their dungeons to conquer the Overworld. Each turn, players draft and place terrain tiles and monster tokens. Their goal: to craft the map with the greatest Power and become the ultimate Overboss!

Title: Rune Stones
Description_Short: Summon creatures, gain gems, forge artifacts and gain the throne first.
Description_Long: Rune Stones is a deck-building, hand management game by acclaimed designer RÃ?diger Dorn. In Rune Stones, every card has a unique number on it. Two cards are always played together, and the higher numbered card is removed from the players deck. You have to be careful which cards you buy and how you play them to not lose your best cards. Players will use their cards to gather gems, forge them into Artifacts, then combine those into Rune Stones, which grants a special ability for the rest of the game. The more artifacts used in making a Rune Stone, the more points it scores, so players must decide whether it is best to gain abilities early or save to score more points.

Title: Jungle Speed
Description_Short: Flip a card, watch like an eagle for a match, and be the fastest to grab the totem.
Description_Long: In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes. It requires a steady hand -- which can be hard to maintain during the many fits of maniacal laughter! The wooden Totem sits in the middle of the table, waiting for the player with the fastest reflexes to snatch it up and win the game.

Title: Sanctum
Description_Short: Gather loot, level up and be sure to become strong enough to defeat the Demon Lord!
Description_Long: Sanctum is a competitive strategy game inspired by hack-and-slash RPG video games. Each player controls one of four unique characters as they journey into the heart of the fallen city of Sanctum, building up their skills and arsenals along the way to prepare for the final fight against the Demon Lord.

Title: Capital Lux
Description_Short: Assign Citizens to your Hometown or the Capital in this futuristic tactical card game
Description_Long: Description from the publisher:

Title: Transatlantic
Description_Short: Compete for passengers and freight in diverse shipping lanes.
Description_Long: From the opening of the Suez Canal in 1869 to the beginning of WWI in 1914, there was an amazing development of bigger, faster, and more modern steamships. Whereas in 1870 there are still many clippers around and the good old paddle steamer Scotia sails the North Atlantic, sea trade is dominated by the end of this era by huge vessels like Mauretania(Cunard), Olympic(White Star), or Imperator(Hapag).

Title: Empires in Arms
Description_Short: Intense simulation of the Napoleonic Wars that ranged across Europe, 1805-1815.
Description_Long: (from the back of the box - Avalon Hill edition:)

Title: Battle Cry: 150th Civil War Anniversary Edition
Description_Short: Fight the American Civil War with mini figures on big hexes and tiles!
Description_Long: From the publisher

Title: 6 nimmt! 25 Jahre
Description_Short: Choose sequential cards for rows simultaneously, but avoid adding the 6th card!
Description_Long: In 6 nimmt!, you want to score as few points as possible. To play, you shuffle the 104 number cards, lay out four cards face-up to start the four rows, then deal ten cards to each player. Each turn, players simultaneously choose and reveal a card from their hand, then add the cards to the rows, with cards being placed in ascending order based on their number; specifically, each card is placed in the row that ends with the highest number thats below the cards number. When the sixth card is placed in a row, the owner of that card claims the other five cards and the sixth card becomes the first card in a new row.

Title: Habitats
Description_Short: Build a wildlife park - but be sure to give your animals the terrain they need!
Description_Long: In Habitats, each player builds a big wildlife park without cages or fences. The animals in your park need their natural habitats: grassland, bush, rocks or lakes. The zebra needs a big area of grass and some water adjacent, for example, while a bat needs rocks and bush and water, a hart needs bush and grass, and a crocodile needs mainly water. There is a snake, baboon, bee, elephant, otter, lizard, turtle, eagle, meerkat, scorpio, hog, catfish, rhino, etc., each with its own landscape requirements â€” 68 different animals in total.

Title: Adventure Games: The Dungeon
Description_Short: You awaken in a dungeon with no memory of how you got there. Use your wits to escape.
Description_Long: Explore places, combine items, and experience stories in Adventure Games, a series of co-operative games from German publisher KOSMOS. In each of these titles, players are presented with a mysterious story that they must unravel over the course of play. Working together, players explore common areas, talk to people, look for clues, and combine various items to reveal the secret of the story. Depending on what decisions the players make, the course of history changes and there is no going back!

Title: Perseverance: Castaway Chronicles â€“ Episodes 1 & 2
Description_Short: Discover a living dinosaur world in a series of mechanically evolving strategy games.
Description_Long: Caught in an enigmatic storm, a modern-day luxury ocean liner crashes ashore on an otherworldly island. As one of the ambitious survivors, you soon learn that the island is home to a multitude of majestic and fiercely territorial dinosaurs. With the cruiser beyond repair, you have no choice but to establish a foothold on the island, withstand the onslaught of the dinosaurs, and sow the seeds of what will one day become a strong and tenacious community capable of discovering the mystery of the island.

Title: Imaginarium
Description_Short: Collect and combine devices to be the best inventor in a fantastic world.
Description_Long: Imaginarium is a strategy, combination and development game.

Title: Ave Caesar
Description_Short: Welcome to the Circus Maximus. Jostle for pole position with your Roman chariot.
Description_Long: Set in the Roman stadium Circus Maximus, players use cards to move their chariots around a quasi-variable track. The track itself has bottlenecks and lane-changing restrictions, which make the race interesting for the racers (very similar to Detroit-Cleveland Grand Prix or Daytona 500). Players are required to race three laps, and they must stop to Hail Caesar before they can finish (a pit stop). The game is light, but if you waste too many moves taking the longer, outside-routes on corners, you may not have enough movement to finish the race. Later, the game was revamped into Ausgebremst, with the most notable changes being modular boards and options to reduce the luck.

Title: Mangrovia
Description_Short: Only a chief knows the best placement for a hut!
Description_Long: In Mangrovia, a light gamers game/family game with a Caribbean mangrove setting, a clever role selection mechanism allows the players to choose two different bonuses/actions as well as the turn order in which they want these actions to be carried out â€” all by placing just one marker. Victory is achievable through a number of viable options, which guarantees high re-playability.

Title: Iwari
Description_Short: Use tents and totems to gain dominance over the different regions of Iwari!
Description_Long: Evermore have they walked the world of Iwari. Evermore have they embodied its spirit and shaped its lands. They are stewards of the earth. Five Titans that make the cosmos breath. On Iwari, there are no teeming masses, no continent-wide civilizations. Humanity is in its infancy, living in scattered tribes in forest, tundra, and desert.

Title: Mordheim: City of the Damned
Description_Short: Build a warband for skirmish wargaming in the Warhammer Fantasy universe.
Description_Long: Mordheim does to Warhammer Fantasy what Necromunda does to Warhammer 40k. The game mechanics work in classic Games Workshop fashion.

Title: Key Flow
Description_Short: Spend a year creating the best medieval city through building, farming and shipping.
Description_Long: The great river Key Flow passes through the new Key Lands, carrying ships laden with resources for building and trade. Along the riverside, buildings are built, boats are moored in docks, and animals graze in the fields. Players build communities alongside this river, and send workers (known as keyples) to work in both their own and their neighbors businesses, enabling their economy to develop and flourish.

Title: The Great Heartland Hauling Co.
Description_Short: Visit, haul, deliver.
Description_Long: In The Great Heartland Hauling Co. (originally announced as Over the Road), players take on the role of medium haul Midwest truck drivers doing their best to make a living by hauling goods for big suppliers. Players truck to various locations around Americas Heartland, picking up and dropping off goods using matching cards from their hands. Most locations have native goods that require fewer cards to load; other locations may pay a premium for those goods but may also require more fuel  and time  to get there with the cargo. With limited space in each trailer and only five cards in hand at a time, players will have to expertly manage their resources, as well as play the odds and press their luck to be the best trucker on the road.

Title: KÃ¶nig von Siam
Description_Short: Fight for the control of Siam as factions fight, while staving off the colonisers.
Description_Long: Siam 1874: A power struggle has broken out. Siams king has initiated reforms that have resulted in a clash between the Malays, Lao, and Royalists. The appearance of unity, however, must be preserved or the British might move in and make a colony out of Siam. Will the Siamese succeed in this tightrope walk and maintain the nation of freedom?

Title: Sorcerer City
Description_Short: Build and re-build magical cities under an ever-increasing time pressure.
Description_Long: Every year, Sorcerer City gets built and rebuilt in magically new ways, with blocks moving and rotating in crazy directions. You and your fellow players are rival wizard architects in charge of building the same city district over five years, expanding it and rebuilding it to gain the most money, influence, magic, and victory. Unfortunately, Sorcerer City has a bit of a monster problem, so you must work hard to mitigate the effects of marauding creatures who attack your city district. The wizard architect with the most victory points at the end of five years will be crowned the new head wizard of all of Sorcerer City.

Title: Chocolate Factory
Description_Short: Create the most efficient assembly line to produce the most delicious chocolate.
Description_Long: Set in the early 20th century of entrepreneurs and chocolatiers experimenting with new ways to create and market chocolates, YOU are assigned the task of chief chocolate maker! Chocolate Factory is a euro game of literal factory building and moving (using a pushable conveyer belt component) chocolates you must complete the largest number of chocolates required by retailers for the best value. The game also features wooden chocolate pieces and a movable conveyer belt making the physicality blended with euro mechanics a unique experience.

Title: Leonardo da Vinci
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long:
Theme:
Florence, fifteenth century. The inventors of the Renaissance created amazing machines for the Lord of the city. Become the protagonist of this age of unbelievable discoveries by realizing your inventions! Youll direct your team into the laboratories, workshops, among the shops and perhaps learn the intrigues of the palace. Only the best can rival the great Leonardo!

Title: Kamisado
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Kamisado is a game of pure skill and strategy with no dice, cards or other chance element â€” its just you against your opponent!

Title: Bruxelles 1897
Description_Short: Position yourself for lasting Art Nouveau fame at the Brussels World Fair.
Description_Long: BRUXELLES 1897

Title: Axis & Allies
Description_Short: Re-fight WWII on a global scale with plastic soldiers, tanks, planes, and ships!
Description_Long: Axis and Allies is the most successful of Milton Bradleys Gamemaster series.

Title: Ascension: Rise of Vigil
Description_Short: Harness energy shards to fuel powerful effects in the race for honor.
Description_Long: Ascension: Rise of Vigil is a deck-building game in which players acquire cards from a central pool, then place those cards in their discard pile to be shuffled into their deck for later use; creatures also show up in that shared card pool, and players can combat them to earn victory points (VPs) and possibly other benefits, such as the ability to remove less useful cards from their deck or to banish cards from the pool that others might find useful. The game ends once all the available VPs have been claimed or the shared deck of cards runs out.

Title: Here to Slay
Description_Short: Powerful heroes band together to slay monsters for their abilities.
Description_Long: Here to Slay is a competitive role-playing fantasy strategy card game thats all about assembling a party of Heroes and slaying monsters (and sometimes sabotaging your friends too) from the creators of Unstable Unicorns.

Title: Love Letter: Adventure Time
Description_Short: Win the princess affection by eliminating opposition through special card powers.
Description_Long: Adventure Time Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 24 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai, except re-themed with characters of the hit cartoon Adventure Time. Players are suitors trying to gain the affections of Princess Bubblegum (#8).

Title: 1849: The Game of Sicilian Railways
Description_Short: The poor get poorer in this economic beatdown set on the island of Sicily.
Description_Long: Originally dubbed a game-kit, this 18xx offering involves laying track lines and purchasing shares within the entire island of Sicily (1849 to 1922). A more easily managed and quicker game of its type, but with a few different nuances.

Title: Machina Arcana (Second/Third Edition)
Description_Short: A group of explorers are traveling the unknown while facing Lovecraftian horrors.
Description_Long: In Machina Arcana, players take on the role of explorers who are investigating an ancient subterranean complex of unknown origin. They face monsters inspired by H. P. Lovecrafts Cthulhu mythos in a steampunk setting. The adventurers collect equipment, interact and utilize their environment, fight monsters, and immerse themselves in the rich narrative elements.

Title: Helvetia
Description_Short: Build new homes, bring culture to your village, and sell essential goods at market.
Description_Long: The cover and name might have you thinking trivia game, but Matthias Cramer has something else in mind for you in Helvetia.

Title: Carcassonne: Amazonas
Description_Short: Paddle down the Amazon as you explore the local villages and wildlife.
Description_Long: In Carcassonne: Amazonas, players sail their boats to the Amazon to discover abundant wildlife. Players score points not only for discovering animals, but also for visiting native villages and water courses while their boat moves forward on the Amazon. Amazon is full of caimans and piranhas which often (and somewhat unpredictably) bring points to those who are farthest down the river (you move your boats forward when you encounter boat symbols on your water courses and also when you do not place any meeple on water courses or villages, nor huts in jungles). The game ends - as usual - when all tiles have been used up, and the two boats fartherst down the river score some bonus points (depending on the number of players).

Title: New York Slice
Description_Short: Build your ultimate pizza. Slice it well, or you may end up stuck with anchovies.
Description_Long: Game description from the publisher:

Title: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle  Defence Against the Dark Arts
Description_Short: Acquire the best spells, items and allies to defend yourself and stun your rival!
Description_Long: Harry Potterâ„¢ Hogwartsâ„¢ Battle Defence Against the Dark Arts is a competitive deck-building game for two players, inspired by Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle. In this fast-paced game, players take turns playing cards, taking actions and acquiring new cards to build a more powerful deck as their defensive skills improve. Stun your opponent three times to win!

Title: Hare & Tortoise
Description_Short: Carefully spend your carrots and lettuces to move around the board and win the race!
Description_Long: As the first winner of the Spiel des Jahres award in 1979, Hare and Tortoise or the German Hase und Igel (for Hare and Hedgehog) will always be regarded as a classic game. It is a cunningly designed race to the finish in which your fuel (carrots) must practically run out (all but 10 carrots or fewer) at the moment you hit the finish line. You also have three lettuce cards you must spend during the course of the race. The farther you move, the more carrots you spend, and there are a variety of ways to gain or lose carrots as you go around the track. Its a very clever exercise in arithmetic which David Parlett has fashioned into an entertaining and unique perennial favorite.

Title: Unmatched: Battle of Legends, Volume Two
Description_Short: More heroes, more villains, more legends, more fights.
Description_Long: In battle, there are no equals.

Title: New Bedford
Description_Short: Strategic yet approachable game of whaling and town-building in mid-1800s New England
Description_Long: Set in the mid-1800s, the golden age of whaling, New Bedford gives you the chance to build the Massachusetts town of the same name into a thriving whaling community. Gather resources to add buildings with new actions and launch ships to go whaling. Go out longest for the best choice, but wait too long and the whales become harder to catch. And dont forget to pay your crew when ships return! Carefully balance time management and timing to earn the most points in this medium-weight worker placement and resource management game.

Title: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Description_Short: Grab the treasure and run for it before the rolling boulder seals you in!
Description_Long:
The publisher says:
The Adventurers features a fast-paced thrilling run through the Temple of Chac, the Mayan rain god. As your intrepid adventurers delve through the ruins, they will face deadly traps guarding the ancient relics they prize.

Title: Wooden Ships & Iron Men
Description_Short: Refight the titanic battles of the age of sail in this hex and counter wargame.
Description_Long: Fighting ships in the age of sail! This classic title details military engagements in the golden age of sail with a plethora of historical scenarios. Players take their groups of ships and form their ship lines and then go at it. The game comes with a large generic ocean map overlaid with a hex grid. The ship counters occupy two hexes and include special rules for moving and firing with this design. Players can begin with the smaller scenarios and work up to whole fleets engaged in pitched battle.

Title: The King Is Dead
Description_Short: A subtle game of shifting power and control over Arthurian Britain.
Description_Long: The King Is Dead is a board game of politics and power struggles set in Britain in the chaotic period following the death of King Arthur. For the good of the country, a leader must unite the Scots, Welsh, and Romano-British â€” not by conquest but by diplomacy.

Title: The Hanging Gardens
Description_Short: Landscape Architects manicure their gardens in order to impress the Queen!
Description_Long: The Hanging Gardens were one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, but did they actually exist? Nothing remains of the reported splendor of the Gardens, which were built for the eyes of Queen Amyitis.

Title: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game
Description_Short: As a character from the books, solve cases and beat the odds in the final showdown.
Description_Long: Description from the publisher:

Title: Conquest of the Empire
Description_Short: Build an army, write laws, and ultimately be the conqueror the Mediterranean.
Description_Long: This game is a remake of the 1984 classic that was part of Milton Bradleys Gamemaster Series. In this game you are one of many Roman generals vying for power in Imperial Rome, employing legions, cavalry, and catapults to reach your objectives.

Title: Riff Raff
Description_Short: Make sure your gear doesnâ€™t topple overboard, and be ready to catch it if it does.
Description_Long: A dexterity game where players take turning loading wooden stuff onto a swaying wooden ship. Bottles, sailors, rats and other cargo are placed on the body of the ship and three yardarms that protrude from the mast.

Title: Guilds of London
Description_Short: Control the Guilds to control business and trade in the great city.
Description_Long: London: The biggest, most important and richest city in England in the late medieval and early modern periods.

Title: Salem 1692
Description_Short: Uncover the witches hiding among the townsfolk before they turn the town against you.
Description_Long: Accuse and defend your fellow townsfolk as you hunt down the witches of Salem. Act fast, before conspiracy turns you against your own.

Title: Endangered
Description_Short: Influence ambassadors and stop habitat destruction to save an endangered species.
Description_Long: The march of humankindâ€™s progress threatens the survival of many species. Its up to you and your team to save them!

Title: Catan Histories: Settlers of America  Trails to Rails
Description_Short: Head west to settle new lands and build new trade cities.
Description_Long: Catan is off the island and in America. Fans of Catan are eagerly anticipating the next release in the Catan Histories line.

Title: Kolejka
Description_Short: Taste the absurd reality of communist economics by queuing at shops without goods.
Description_Long: Get in a queue with your family in front of a store and experience a rush of genuine emotions!

Title: Lotus
Description_Short: Craft beautiful flowers with card combos and insect bonuses.
Description_Long: Lotus is a beautiful game that grows into a unique work of art every time you play.

Title: Star Trek Panic
Description_Short: Relive the classic TV sci-fi show and avoid all the dangers from all directions.
Description_Long: Star Trek Panic is a cooperative light strategy game based on Castle Panic that challenges players to defend the U.S.S. Enterprise from enemy attacks.

Title: Qin
Description_Short: Control areas in the grid with your tiles to place your pagodas and win.
Description_Long: In Qin players colonize the Chinese hinterland, seize territories, and expand their influence by placing tiles and pagodas.

Title: Perikles
Description_Short: Balance Grecian civics with foreign wars as you vie to lead to glory.
Description_Long: Perikles is a game from Martin Wallace. Players assume the role of a noble family seeking to become the leader of one or more of 6 ancient Greek city-states. The game plays out in two phases:

Title: Mysthea
Description_Short: Survive the mysteries and perils of an ancient planet shaken by bizarre forces.
Description_Long: Mysthea is a hand building / management and area control eurogame from Tabula Games, where time-tested euro mechanics get a modern twist and are infused with a strongly thematic design to immerse you in the strange world of Icaion.

Title: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous  Base Set
Description_Short: Level up your party in this card-and-dice fantasy campaign set in the Abyss.
Description_Long: Game description from the publisher:

Title: Youre Bluffing!
Description_Short: Place blind bids to gain farm animals or bluff to get your oponents gold!
Description_Long:
Classic bidding and bluffing game. The deck consists of sets of farm animals, 4 cards per animal. Players auction off the top animal of the deck, or try to complete their set by trading with another player. Highest bid wins, but auctioneer always has the choice to buy the animal for the same price as the highest bid.
Trading is a blind bidding system: both players place their bid face down on the table and reveal them simultaneously to each other. High bidder gets the other players animal. Both players swap their bid. Its best to bid just a little bit more than your opponent, but just how much did he bid?

Title: Ganymede
Description_Short: Get your settlers to Ganymede so they can colonize the stars!
Description_Long: Ganymede is a development and tableau-building game in which players are corporations specialized in sending settlers to colonize the universe. To do so, you will recruit settlers on Earth, use shuttles to transport them to Mars, then to Ganymede where the settlers ships launch base is located.

Title: Snake Oil
Description_Short: Make a creative pitch to sell whatever you end up with!
Description_Long: In the Old West, the wily snake oil salesman had a special talent, getting the most skeptical customers to buy the most dubious products. Now its your turn! Invent your own zany two-word products  Rumor Mirror! Burp Balloon!  and sell them to all types of wacky customers. If the rounds customer buys your product, you win!

Title: Boss Monster 2: The Next Level
Description_Short: Build the ultimate side-scrolling dungeon to lure and defeat Heroes for their souls.
Description_Long: The original Boss Monster challenged players to become the ultimate villains: video game-style Bosses. Now Boss Monster 2 builds on the original in every way! An all-new set of 160 cards, Boss Monster 2 is playable as a standalone game or as an expansion to the core set.

Title: Core Space
Description_Short: Spaceship crawls, bar brawls, and epic windfalls.
Description_Long: Core Space is a science fiction miniatures board game. Each player takes control of a band of Traders trying to make a living in a dangerous galaxy, all the while hunted by the Purge, a semi-sentient race of humanoid machines whose sole task is to harvest worlds.

Title: Ardennes 44: The Battle of the Bulge
Description_Short: A Regimental-level hex and counter exploration of the Battle of the Bulge.
Description_Long: (from GMT website:)

Title: Tranquility
Description_Short: Work together to traverse the seas, complete the grid and reach your island paradise!
Description_Long: Jump on board the good ship Tranquility and set sail for paradise. Take care, though, because in a land where the day blends into night its easy to lose track of time and you still need to find that special little island to call home.

Title: PalastgeflÃ?ster
Description_Short: Whisper the right words at the right ears to scheme through palaces intrigues.
Description_Long: PalastgeflÃ?ster translates literally as Palace Whisperings

Title: World War II: Barbarossa to Berlin
Description_Short: Paths of Glory card driven system modified to recreate blitzkrieg campaigns of WW2.
Description_Long: (from GMT Games:)

Title: Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
Description_Short: Saddle up for more World War I plane-to-plane conflict with five new WoW aircraft!
Description_Long: Wings of War: Watch Your Back! is the second title in the WoW line and is again set in World War I.

Title: Gaslands: Post-Apocalyptic Vehicular Combat
Description_Short: Watch Earthâ€™s deadliest death races in all new Gaslands: tonight at 9 on The Network!
Description_Long: Gaslands is a game of post-apocalyptic vehicular mayhem.

Title: Sorcerer
Description_Short: Confront mystical beings and wield magic to conquer grim fantastical battlefields.
Description_Long: Sorcerer: A Strategy Card Game is set in what the company describes as a grim, gaslamp lit world full of fantastic, mythical creatures and sorcery. Designed for two to four players, the game pits two ancient beings of great power against one another to determine which of their lineage are strongest. The players use sorcery to conjure minions, cast spells, and wield enchanted items to reach the games goal of conquering three battlefields.

Title: KeyForge: Worlds Collide
Description_Short: Your deck is unique. Battle others to be the first to unlock the great Vaults!
Description_Long: The Crucible is about to be shaken up in Worlds Collide, the third age of KeyForge! In this continuation of the worlds first Unique Deck Game, two brand-new Houses enter the fray as 284 new cards are seamlessly integrated into the existing card pool. With new Houses come more new keyword abilities and new styles of play to create an entirely new collection of Archon Decks for you to discover, explore, and master!

Title: Lifeboats
Description_Short: Which boat will move? Who will be fed to the sharks? Negotiate your way toward land!
Description_Long: Also known as Rette Sich Wer Kann (Each Man for Himself) and often times referred to as The Lifeboat Game, this pure negotiation game puts a different spin on the typical ocean catastrophe. Theres been a boating accident, and a rag-tag group of six lifeboats is trying to make its way to one of several islands just over the horizon. However only one boat will make any forward progress in a given turn, so players try to convince everyone to vote for his particular favorite. To further complicate matters, the sailors cant seem to decide which boat they want to be in, so theyre constantly jumping out of boats to swim to another one. As if all that wasnt enough, one of the boats springs a leak each turn. If the boat is at maximum occupancy when the leak occurs, then players vote to decide who to toss to the sharks!

Title: City of Spies: Estoril 1942
Description_Short: Spymasters capture and recruit spies in Portugal against the backdrop of WW2.
Description_Long: Estoril is small town near Lisbon, Portugal. Having a casino, beach and wonderful weather, the region was a center of diplomacy -- and spying -- during World War II.

Title: Pandemic: Hot Zone  North America
Description_Short: 30 minutes to save North America from a viral pandemic â€” all in a days work.
Description_Long: Disease threatens North America and only you can stop it! In Pandemic: Hot Zone  North America, players work together against the game to discover cures for three deadly diseases that threaten the continent. Travel to different North American cities to treat local populations, prevent outbreaks, and share research with your team. Can you discover the cures before its too late?

Title: Impulse
Description_Short: Use multi-use cards to eXplore, eXpand, eXploit, and eXterminate in outer space.
Description_Long: Impulse is a quick-playing 4X (explore, expand, exploit, and exterminate) game set in space with the game board being composed of cards that have actions on them. Players also have cards in hand, and in addition to featuring one of ten possible actions, these cards have a color (red, yellow, blue or green) and a size (1, 2 or 3, as indicated by the number of icons on the card). Each card also has six edges, and these edges connect adjacent cards in the hex-shaped playing area.

Title: Fighting Formations: Grossdeutschland Motorized Infantry Division
Description_Short: Take command of elements of this elite German formation from June 1942 to March 1943.
Description_Long: Fighting Formations is a fledgling series of games, which will focus on several battles of various individual formations during World War II. The first title in the series is Grossdeutschland Infantry Division. Future titles arent yet set in stone but could be devoted to other famous divisions (Big Red One), Corps (Afrika Korps), regiments (442nd RCT), Commando troops, Ranger battalions, etc.

Title: Seikatsu
Description_Short: Outwit your rivals as you design a garden together to ensure you have the best view.
Description_Long: In Seikatsu, players take turns placing tiles into a shared garden area, with each tile showing a colored flower and colored bird. Players score for groups of birds as they place them, but they score for rows of flowers only at the end of the game and only for the rows of flowers that exist from their perspective, i.e., that are viewable as lines from where they sit at the game board.

Title: City of Horror
Description_Short: Zombies are everywhere! Negotiation, voting, and carnage ensue. Will you make it?
Description_Long: City of Horror is a backstabbing survival-horror game. As in classic zombie movies, a shambling horde is invading the city. The goal is to survive the assault. (Un)fortunately, surviving often means sacrificing some of your fellow players to the undead...

Title: Steampunk Rally Fusion
Description_Short: Its a race to the finish unless your machine explodes on the way!
Description_Long: Steampunk Rally Fusion is a standalone game that can be combined with the original Steampunk Rally. It introduces new tracks with unique event cards, new part abilities (Gear Up and Overcharge), and a new card type: Secret Projects. It also debuts new custom dice representing powerful Fusion energy!

Title: Elasund: The First City
Description_Short: Build & fortify city together. Make sure that pirates will plunder others, not you.
Description_Long: This is the second game in the Abenteuer Catan (Catan Adventures) series that started with Candamir: The First Settlers. The theme of Elasund is based on the Die Siedler von Catan novel written by Rebecca GablÃ©, itself based on the original The Settlers of Catan game. In Elasund, players compete and cooperate to build the premier city of Catan.

Title: Vast: The Mysterious Manor
Description_Short: A scuffle in a mysterious manor between opposing, completely different forces!
Description_Long: Vast: The Mysterious Manor FAQ (unoffical rules FAQ)

Title: Mindbug
Description_Short: Serve the Mindbug, summon hybrids, and mind-control your opponent's best cards.
Description_Long: In Mindbug, you summon hybrid creatures and send them to battle against your opponent â€” but when you summon a creature, the opponent may use one of their Mindbugs to take control of it. Outwit your opponent in a fascinating tactical duel in which having the best cards and playing them at the wrong time can be deadly for yourself.

Title: Quests of Valeria
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: In Quests of Valeria you play the role of a Guild Master, recruiting and dispatching Citizens to complete quests posted in a tavern in the Capital City of Valeria to earn Victory Points. The player with the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins.

Title: Cryo
Description_Short: Competing factions must scavenge the wreckage of their colony ship to survive.
Description_Long: A mission gone wrong. Tensions continued to mount aboard your colony ship as the days dragged on. An anonymous act of sabotage has sent the ship plummeting to the surface of a frozen uncharted planet. Damaged beyond repair, the scattered remains will do little to protect you from the brutal cold.

Title: Caesar!: Seize Rome in 20 Minutes!
Description_Short: Caesar and Pompey deploy units to battlegrounds across Rome to seize control!
Description_Long: The Roman Republic is coming to an end, but not before a power struggle between Caesar and Pompey. Players will command their legions, strategically deploying them to key battlegrounds to try and seize control of the provinces and become ruler of the republic.

Title: Pit
Description_Short: Worlds liveliest card game. Trade 1! Trade 2! Trade 3! Trade 4! Corner the market.
Description_Long: Pit is an open-outcry commodity trading game. The first edition in 1903 had a deck of 63 cards, 9 each of 7 commodities, each with a value (ranging from 40 for Flax to 100 for Wheat). Players offer trades by crying out the number of cards they want to swap (â€œOne! One! One!â€ù, or â€œThree! Three! Three!â€ù) but not their identity. The winner of the hand is the first to collect all of one commodity, declaring â€œCorner on Wheat!â€ù or whatever commodity has been collected. The winner of the hand scores points equal to the value of the commodity, and the winner of the game is the first to 500 points.

Title: Risk: Europe
Description_Short: Dominate Europe like never before in this Euro-Conflict hybrid of epic proportions!
Description_Long:
Description from the publisher:
Control the crowns, control Europe in the Risk Europe game--an exciting game of medieval conquest. The game challenges players to step into the role of a medieval king and rule feudal Europe by building castles, taxing subjects, expanding territories, and engaging in battle. This in-depth game of strategy and conquest offers serious gamers a premium gameplay experience. It features 4 separate armies and 7 unique starting kingdoms, each with its own strengths and abilities, plus Kings Orders cards that play an important role in strategy.

Title: Dungeon Twister 2: Prison
Description_Short: Escape the dungeon or die trying in this renewed head-to-head duel of wits.
Description_Long: Dungeon Twister 2: Prison will re-launch the Dungeon Twister franchise with second edition rules. It will contain 16 miniatures, new rooms, new characters, a tutorial in 5 scenarios, a larger box and best of all, rules for Solitaire play!

Title: Ribbit
Description_Short: Racing game where resting atop another players piece helps you get ahead.
Description_Long: Turtles are not always in a hurry, but even they get to be in a race to try and become the first turtle to get to the tasty salad at the other end of the field. But since turtles donâ€™t have a lot of endurance, they like to rest once in a while  preferably on the back of another turtle so that they can get carried for a little while.

Title: Mafia de Cuba
Description_Short: Catch diamond thieves or steal from the mob boss in this social deduction game.
Description_Long: Havana, December 29, 1955: At the end of the meal offered at his faithful henchmen, don Alessandro evokes the business in progress. Suddenly, the phone rang in the back room of the restaurant. The Godfather is convened to the office of President Batista. He entrusted his precious cigar box to his henchmen. It must be said that the cigar box has a false bottom, under the first layer of cigars, the box is filled with diamonds!

Title: After The Virus
Description_Short: Save the survivors, equip yourself and kill the zombies, the mission is to survive.
Description_Long: The zombie apocalypse is here! After The Virus is a cooperative deck builder in which you and your friends band together to survive and complete different missions. The 15 included missions form a storyline if played in sequence, but dont expect to survive that easily because the zombies will attack you in ever increasing numbers!

Title: Ticket to Ride: First Journey (U.S.)
Description_Short: The whole family races to collect tickets and travel by train from coast to coast.
Description_Long: Ticket to Ride: First Journey takes the gameplay of the Ticket to Ride series and scales it down for a younger audience.

Title: Stop Thief!
Description_Short: A thief on the loose! But you cant see them; you can only HEAR them!
Description_Long: An alert pops up on your smartphone: A crime has just been committed! Grab your investigators license and your keen powers of deduction and hunt down the suspect. But watch out because youre not the only private eye on the hunt, and only one of you can slap the cuffs on the suspect and claim the reward. Get enough reward money, and you can finally leave this rat race behind and retire to a sunny tropical beach in the Caribbean.

Title: The Princes of Machu Picchu
Description_Short: Incan Princes sacrifice to the gods, but will the Spaniards discover Machu Picchu?
Description_Long: When the Spaniards conquered the Incan Empire, only a few princes managed to flee into the mountains. Well-hidden high above the river Urabumba is a place the Spanish would never discover: The lost city of Machu Picchu. But beware! Is there a traitor among the princes, ready to reveal the location of the secret city to the Spaniards?

Title: High Frontier (Third Edition)
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: High Frontier (3rd edition) is a space exploration game by Phil Eklund. The players take control of different space enterprises trying to establish factories on planets and asteroids. Each player begins with three water tanks (fuel). In turns each player uses two action points to do some of the eight actions available, e.g. move space ship or buy new technologies. When the predetermined number of bases is built the game ends. The winner is the player with the most victory points.

Title: The Flow of History
Description_Short: Develop the most advanced civilization through the ages of history.
Description_Long: Description from the publisher:

Title: TEN
Description_Short: An exciting push-your-luck and auction game for the whole family!
Description_Long: TEN is an exciting push-your-luck and auction game for the whole family! Players draw cards one-at-a-time, trying to add as many as they can without exceeding a total value of TEN, or they bust!

Title: Bios: Genesis
Description_Short: Uncover the birth of life on Earth either competing or collaborating.
Description_Long: Description from the publisher:

Title: Sail to India
Description_Short: Sail, trade or employ your versatile cubes in Age-of-Discovery-ish micro strategy.
Description_Long: The Age of Discovery, Portugal, 15th16th century: With the Mediterranean under Osman Turk control, the Portuguese were severely limited in the Mediterranean and looking for other trade routes. Better ships, better compasses, and a general centralization of power helped push the Portuguese explorers into the Atlantic, and sailors like Prince Henry, Bartolomeu Dias and Vasco da Gama took to the seas.

Title: Axis & Allies: 1942
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: Game description from the publisher:

Title: Terra
Description_Short: You may not know for sure, but close counts.
Description_Long: Game description from the publisher:

Title: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc
Description_Short: Relive the golden age of chivalry in a narrative game of knights, heroes and dragons.
Description_Long: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc is set amid the tumult of the 100 Years War, when kings and princes struggle for the throne of France. This is the age of knights and squires, where chivalry is often spoken of, but rarely practiced. It is a time of both religion and superstition. Educated clerics fervently believe that angels guard the pious, and demons scourge the wicked, while the simpler folk watch the night for signs of werewolves and dragons. The game assumes that all of these are real.

Title: Warfighter: The WWII Tactical Combat Card Game
Description_Short: Guide a squad of soldiers in WW2 as they fight in Europe after D-Day.
Description_Long: Warfighter is a card game for 1 to 6 players. You play cooperatively with your friends against the system to complete World War II squad-level combat missions.

Title: Kepler-3042
Description_Short: Spend your resources wisely as you forge out to colonize your slice of the galaxy.
Description_Long: The year is 3042: Humanity is ready to explore the galaxy. The most interesting celestial bodies to explore, and eventually colonize, have been known for centuries, and the nations of Earth finally have the technological level to reach them, thus beginning an unarmed competition that in the end the whole of humanity will win.

Title: Heroscape Master Set: Battle for the Underdark
Description_Short: D&D inspired heroes form teams and battle through a maze of your own making.
Description_Long: The third Master Set for the HeroScape series of games, which crosses over into the realm of Dungeons and Dragons. Includes 10 rebased figures from Dungeons & Dragons Miniatures and 55 Heroscape-style terrain pieces.

Title: Wealth of Nations
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: In Wealth of Nations, you take on the role of a national leader. Your goal is to take your nation from humble beginnings to the status of a world economic superpower. You achieve this by building Industries, which allows you to produce Commodities. There are six types of Industry tiles: Farms, Generators, Academies, Mines, Factories, and Banks. Each Industry is capable of producing a certain type of Commodity: Food, Energy, Labor, Ore, and Capital (respectively).

Title: American Rails
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: In American Rails, each player assumes the role of a wealthy capitalist managing a portfolio of stocks and bonds in six fictional railroad companies. Through ruthless negotiation and rigorous planning, players struggle to increase the value of their holdings and reap the profits. The player with the most money at the end of the game will become the nations first railroad baron and win the game.

Title: Agents of SMERSH
Description_Short: Secret agents race across the globe to thwart the plans of the sinister Dr. Lobo.
Description_Long: A STORYTELLING BOARD GAME SET IN THE 1970s COLD WAR ERA.

Title: Dominations: Road to Civilization
Description_Short: Build cities and develop technologies in this abstract, domino-style civ game.
Description_Long: Dominations: Road to Civilization is a 24 player game by Olivier Melison and Eric Dubus. In this domino-based civilization building game, players take on the role of a primitive tribe, which they will seek to grow into a nation whose influence will echo through the ages...

Title: Flatline
Description_Short: Save patients as fast as you can in this high-stress sci-fi sick bay.
Description_Long: Description from the publisher:

Title: Catan: Starfarers
Description_Short: Explore, settle and trade in the far reaches of space.
Description_Long: Twenty years ago, the settlers started into the depths of the galaxy to discover unknown planets, the undiscovered universe lying before them. Maybe theyll find planets with good ore or carbon deposits â€” or perhaps only barren ice planets. They might encounter alien folks and start lucrative trading, with pirates and wormholes being a constant challenge for them.

Title: Zombie 15
Description_Short: Frantically work together as group of teens in a world plagued by zombie hordes.
Description_Long: In an apocalyptic world in which everyone over the age of 18 has turned into a bloodthirsty, flesh-hungry zombie and most youngsters have been served as meat to quell their elders appetite, a small team of kids and teenagers tries to survive on their own. As part of that small group of survivors, you must unite to escape the relentless horde of undead. Run across town to find shelter or food, hold a strategic position, meet with new survivors, and discover the truth about this terrible and mysterious disease!

Title: Belratti
Description_Short: Sneaky Belratti has placed fake paintings in your museum. Can you spot the forgery?
Description_Long: You are buying artwork for your museum, always trying to meet the current trends and finding genuine art from your associates. But the famous Belratti is trying to cheat his own fake paintings into your collection.

Title: Cube Quest
Description_Short: Knock your opponents king out of his castle in a quick and fun dice flicking game.
Description_Long: Cube Quest is a dexterity game in which lightweight hollow cubic dice are flicked across custom rubber mats. Cubes that leave the mats are defeated. Play alternates until someone wins by defeating the enemy king. Cubes also risk defeat in enemy territory; if they land shadow side up, they have been captured and must be rolled, like dice, to determine whether they escape.

Title: Lignum (Second Edition)
Description_Short: Choose your pace in this economic race for logging supremacy. Every step counts!
Description_Long: Starting with a limited amount of resources and workers, you set out to run your lumber mill as efficiently as possible. Savvy investments and proper planning will ensure that your mill will be the most profitable. Be cautious, however, for competition is fierce! You will need to secure the best cutting areas, make use of limited contract workers, and continually update and replace your equipment. Your competitors are not the only thing to worry about as you will also need to store enough firewood and food to survive the harsh winters.

Title: Glow
Description_Short: Build your company by recruiting new traveling companions and combine their power.
Description_Long: In Glow, you are an adventurer who builds their company by recruiting a new traveling companion each turn, trying to combine their powers as best as possible. You'll roll the dice to activate the advantages that your companions bring you...or their disadvantages. Gather many slivers of light to dispel the darkness, restore the colors, travel the land to reach landmarks, and (yes) score points.

Title: Razzia!
Description_Short: Bid to acquire the best booty, but act quickly before the police break up the party.
Description_Long: Razzia! is a card game re-implementation of Knizias earlier board game Ra with the only notable changes being the re-theme and lack of catastrophes.

Title: Tabannusi: Builders of Ur
Description_Short: Build the great ancient city of Ur.
Description_Long: Set in ancient Mesopotamia, a cradle of civilization, at a time when the location of Ur was a coastal region, players work to build the Great City of Ur, expand its districts, and establish themselves as powerful builders.

Title: Juicy Fruits
Description_Short: Collect fruits and put them to clever use to end up with the most attractive island.
Description_Long: Each player has their own small island paradise where they grow delicious fruit. To win, you must gain the most points by cleverly supplying ships and by adding the best businesses to your island.

Title: Spades
Description_Short: A trick-taking partnership game with contracts where spades are always trump suit.
Description_Long: This trick-taking game is a standard deck playing card game and takes on many different group-specific rules. Generally speaking, each player is given thirteen cards and a partner who sits across the table. Each player bids the number of tricks hell take, and then the partners collectively attempt to take at least as many as they bid. The tricks are fairly standard with following suit if you can, and spades as the trump suit. If you make your bid you earn ten times the number of tricks you bid, otherwise you lose that many points. Plus there is usually a nil bid, which means you personally wont take any tricks but your partner still plays as normal.

Title: Dragonwood
Description_Short: Roll to defeat monsters and collect items! Will you be able to defeat the dragon?
Description_Long: Game description from the publisher:

Title: Keltis
Description_Short: Play cards in order and move on tracks, giving you more points the further you go.
Description_Long: Keltis is a multi-player game based on Lost Cities, with some rules changes, later published with Knizias original rules and theme as Lost Cities: The Board Game.

Title: Frostgrave
Description_Short: Take on the role of a wizard. Build your warband for skirmishes in the Frozen City.
Description_Long: Amidst the frozen ruins of an ancient city, wizards battle in the hopes of discovering the treasures of a fallen empire. In the fantasy skirmish wargame Frostgrave, each player takes on the role of a wizard from one of ten schools of magic, and builds his band of followers. The wizards apprentice usually accompanies his master, and more than a dozen other henchman types are available for hire, from lowly thugs to heavily armored knights and stealthy thieves. Wizards can expand their magical knowledge by unlocking ancient secrets and may learn up to 80 different spells.

Title: DungeonQuest
Description_Short: Flip tiles and die horribly (almost always) as you try to loot the wizards dungeon.
Description_Long: Players explore the ruins of Castle Dragonfire trying to reach the treasure chamber in the center of the dungeon and escape alive with as much treasure as possible. A limited number of turns before the game ends puts pressure on players to take risks and score rewards because anyone left in the dungeon when time runs out dies! A tile-laying system creates the maze-like dungeon and ensures that no two games are ever exactly the same.

Title: Florenza
Description_Short: Add a Brief Description
Description_Long: In Florenza, the players are the heads of the most powerful families in Florenza during the Renaissance period. The goal of the game is to become the most famous patron of the arts by hiring the most famous artists of the period and financing their works.

Title: Stroganov
Description_Short: Explore the vast expanse of Siberia to gain wealth and fame.
Description_Long: In the 16th century, Russia began to expand eastwards to develop the vast expanses of Siberia. This phase in history is closely associated with the name Stroganov.

Title: JÃ?rvÃ?k
Description_Short: Teach your Vikings to stand in line and await their turn in a tight auction game.
Description_Long: For several decades during the Viking age, parts of England were occupied by the Norsemen. Under their influence, one of the larger cities turned into a flourishing center of trade and craftsmanship. The Vikings called the city and its surrounding kingdom JÃ?rvÃ?k, which is today known as the city of York.

Title: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
Description_Short: Be the first to play out your cards while building a crazy fairytale from scratch.
Description_Long: Once Upon A Time is a game in which the players create a story together, using cards that show typical elements from fairy tales. One player is the Storyteller and creates a story using the ingredients on their cards. They try to guide the plot towards their own ending. The other players try to use cards to interrupt the Storyteller and become the new Storyteller. The winner is the first player to play out all their cards and end with their Happy Ever After card.

Title: Bananagrams
Description_Short: Race to arrange your letter tiles into a crossword before anyone else.
Description_Long: Bananagrams is a fast and fun word game that requires no pencil, paper or board, and the tiles come in a fabric banana-shaped carrying pouch. One hand can be played in as little as five minutes. Much like Pick Two!, but without the letter values.

Title: 5-Minute Mystery
Description_Short: A real-time, co-op, mystery game.
Description_Long: 5-Minute Mystery is a high-intensity, deductive, mystery game in which players work together to find a culprit hidden in a line-up of suspects.

Title: Pastiche
Description_Short: Mix and match the right color palettes to recreate classic artworks.
Description_Long: A world of beautiful colors comes alive in Pastiche as players choose commission cards picturing 34 of the finest European art works of the past six centuries. Players score their commissions by mixing primary colors through clever tile placement and recreating the palette of colors used by the masters who created these works.
